column4: I think that driver would be included in the cups-driver-gutenprint package, is that one installed?
I don't think making an alias for ping might be such a good idea, rather "sping" for sudo ping or something,, Agat0n
Other than the -f option, I see nothing bad there.
The pipes are parsed by your shell, not by sudo.
This may be a bad suggestion, but still it would be much simpler to open a root shell with 'sudo -s', use what you want, then exit the root shell.
yes that's what I'm doing currently, I just figured it would be neter with just one command with a sudo in the right place. (but then again... "sudo -i && ... && exit")
You could try sudo bash -c 'foo | bar > somefile'
If it's an often used command, you might put it in a shell script, and then use sudo to execute _that_.
not that common no (it's http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/252442/ btw, *Dangerous command*)
In that type of pipeline, when it ends with a command (not file), you can simply use 'sudo dd if=......'
Basically, gunzip -c ./5ubuntu_8gb_usb_backup.dd.gz.* | sudo of=/dev/sdb bs=1024 conv=notrunc
ok, I guessed it might be but was not sure, cheers.
